summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being sent.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The official signing the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Silvio J. Mollo
persons.context: The building housing the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is named after him.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution and transmission of discovery to the defendant, Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: This document is official correspondence from the U.S. Department of Justice regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of December 2020.
The document shows the ongoing legal process, with the prosecution transmitting discovery materials to the defense.
Audrey Strauss was serving as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at this time.
